intro: Orthocarpus lithospermoides var. bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored orthocarpus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh conditions. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a striking two-color pattern that aids in pollination. This variant is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and ecological significance.
